tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids Shame that the Environmental Agency isn‚Äôt taking RED industries to account over Walley‚Äôs Landfill site at Silverdale, in Newcastle-under-Lyme, Staffordshire that is making thousands of lives a misery due to the daily stench that invades peoples homes and gardens.

Delighted to have secured a debate in Parliament next week on the campaign to stop @bradfordmdc council's plans for an incinerator on the outskirts of #Keighley.

Despite top campaigning by the @AireIncinerator team, the @EnvAgency granted permission last year.üëé

Find out moreüëá https://t.co/H3ugIc8L37

It may look raw right now but with a little bit of time putting the bends back into Dunston Beck will help to improve water quality, flow and biodiversity @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @beeswaxfarming https://t.co/QaEwuT3ze9

I can absolutely assure the @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE that a large % of what we pulled out of 100 yards of the River Lea today was sanitary waste. I would be happy to take the two inspectors who allegedly saw no evidence of sewage/sanitary waste on a paddle down the river. https://t.co/i0UdMygQ97 https://t.co/D2nuqsiYP6

urls.title: Corby man jailed and facing costs of ¬£750,000 for waste crime
urls.description: A Northamptonshire man, who was jailed in January, after a decade of waste offences was ordered this week to pay ¬£12,500 in costs and ¬£140 in victim surcharge.

tweets.text:
A 68-year-old man faces jail time and is ordered to clean up stock-piled waste which could cost him ¬£750,000.

If you suspect any illegal waste activity, please call: 0800 80 70 60

Read more about how we combat #illegal waste here: https://t.co/cksMMi14Qt https://t.co/3Bc9L1ic09

urls.title: Start of the close season: How do we protect our breeding fish at this time of year?
urls.description: Matt Buck, Fisheries Technical Specialist for the Midlands, explains how close season helps protect our breeding fish. Well the evenings are getting lighter, and across the country fish are starting to move out of their winter haunts - a sure ‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
The coarse fish #CloseSeason starts today, meaning it‚Äôs illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15 June inclusive.  

We spoke to Fisheries Officer Matt Buck to find out why the close season is so important üëá

More info: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB #Angling https://t.co/wVVj0shIow

Today I want to highlight a few of the many brilliant women who I have the privilege of working with across @DefraGovUK. They are all playing an important role shaping the #climatechange and #naturerecovery agenda.  #ActOnTheGap #TogetherForOurPlanet #ChooseToChallenge https://t.co/8DiJhU3lez

urls.title: [Withdrawn] Apply for a grant from the natural environment investment readiness fund
urls.description: Grants to prepare innovative nature projects in England that can attract private financial investment. Find out what the fund is for and how to apply.

tweets.text:
The Natural Environment Readiness Investment Fund will help nature projects to seek more private investment to tackle climate change, create habitats and improve water quality.

If you‚Äôre an organisation interested in receiving a grant, apply now: https://t.co/TJnC6BasA7 https://t.co/XBwYnRcBFM

urls.title: Councillor Robbie Moore - NTCA
urls.description: Robbie is a passionate and enthusiastic individual who believes in delivering positive change. In May 2017, Robbie was elected as a County Councillor to represent the Alnwick Division on Northumberland County Council. Robbie sits on the Health and Wellbeing Scrutiny Committee and the North Northumberland Local Area Council which has designated powers for determining planning [‚Ä¶]

tweets.text: @JulieLintern @_RobbieMoore @bradfordmdc @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency He should understand it Julie, As a Councillor on the North Northumberland Local Area Council who has designated powers for determining planning applications. He's got an interesting portfolio as well. https://t.co/81TAsruov1

@hjb53 @EnvAgency @ManCityCouncil @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgencyNW were incredibly helpful yesterday. Replied to my tweet straight away and told me to call the hotline which I did. They said it would be assessed and hopefully removed within 1-2 weeks. I then had an email too! I was very impressed.

@Pierce_Chris_D @KateLymer @BromleyLFB @LBofBromley @EnvAgency @NewsShopper @MPSCrayValleyE @FoEBromley @GreenercleanerB Hi Chris. @AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE Thanks for that. Some areas are looking at trying to hold water back on the moors eg leaky dams. Is this being looked at for the moors above Sheffield and Barnsley which impacts the Lower Don catchment area?
